subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] QS-SAMPA: a proposed format for plain-text Quickscript
msgSnippet: I dont really care what you guys do so long as it stays stable.  I am used to the Jerome mapping and I use it regularly enough that I dont have to think much
messageBody:
I dont really care what you guys do so long as it stays stable.  I am used to the Jerome mapping and I use it regularly enough that I dont have to think much when I am typing.  As a result, your changes will mean that I will have to relearn, and I would rather not have to relearn AGAIN later.  So, before we make the change to the mapping, lets make sure that we get it absolutely right.  In my mind this means that the most used letters are in lower case, with the alternatives and the less used letters on the upper case.  Also having logical keys for eg Thither and Thoth - H and h.  This would make it much easier to remember.

If I can get the time I will look at Ted's mapping and come up with my suggestions.

Moira


On 01/12/2007, John Cowan < cowan@...> wrote:

Ted Larson Freeman scripsit:
> Well, I was thinking that there would be less craziness with two
> fonts, due to the issue I mentioned: if someone has a document that
> uses the Thoth font and then installs a new version that is also
> called Thoth with a different key mapping, the document will become
> scrambled. Also, if there are two versions, people can try out the new
> version before telling us how much they love or hate it.

Excellent point. Calling it QS-Thoth might be the Right Thing.

--
John Cowan http://ccil.org/~cowan cowan@...
